templates.name: Starlink dish by Prom
templates.description:
Use project Python starlink-grpc-tools

https://github.com/sparky8512/starlink-grpc-tools

Run Starlink exporter:
python dish_grpc_prometheus.py status alert_detail

items.name: Starlink alerts
items.description: A bit field combining all active alerts, where a 1 bit indicates the alert is active. See alert detail status data for which bits correspond with each alert, or to get individual alert flags instead of a combined bit mask.

items.name: Starlink currently obstructed
items.description: Most recent sample value. See *obstructed* in bulk history data for detail. This item still appears to be reported by the user terminal despite no longer appearing in the bulk history data.

items.name: Starlink direction azimuth
items.description: Azimuth angle, in degrees, of the direction in which the user terminal's dish antenna is physically pointing. Note that this generally is not the exact direction of the satellite with which the user terminal is communicating.

items.name: Starlink direction elevation
items.description: Elevation angle, in degrees, of the direction in which the user terminal's dish antenna is physically pointing.

items.name: Starlink downlink throughput bps
items.description: Most recent sample value. See bulk history data for detail.

items.name: Starlink fraction obstructed
items.description: The fraction of total area (or possibly fraction of time?) that the user terminal has determined to be obstructed between it and the satellites with which it communicates.

items.name: Starlink hardware version
items.description: A string identifying the user terminal hardware version.

items.name: Starlink ID
items.description: A string identifying the specific user terminal device that was reachable from the local network. Something like a serial number.

items.name: Starlink obstruction duration
items.description: Average consecutive time, in seconds, the user terminal has detected its signal to be obstructed for a period of time that it considers "prolonged", or None if no such obstructions were recorded.

items.name: Starlink obstruction interval
items.description: Average time, in seconds, between the start of such "prolonged" obstructions, or None if no such obstructions were recorded.

items.name: Starlink ping latency
items.description: Most recent sample value. See bulk history data for detail.

items.name: Starlink pop ping drop rate
items.description: Most recent sample value. See bulk history data for detail.

items.name: Starlink seconds obstructed
items.description:
The amount of time within the history buffer, in seconds, that the user terminal determined to be obstructed, regardless of whether or not packets were able to be transmitted or received.

**OBSOLETE**: The user terminal no longer provides this data.

items.name: Starlink seconds to first nonempty slot
items.description: Amount of time from now, in seconds, until a satellite will be scheduled to be available for transmit/receive. See also *scheduled* in the bulk history data. May report as a negative number, which appears to indicate unknown time until next satellite scheduled and usually correlates with *state* reporting as other than "CONNECTED".

items.name: Starlink snr above noise floor
items.description:
Most recent sample value. See bulk history data for detail.

**OBSOLETE**: The user terminal no longer provides this data.

items.name: Starlink software version
items.description: A string identifying the software currently installed on the user terminal.

triggers.expression: last(/Starlink dish by Prom/starlink.software_version,#1)<>last(/Starlink dish by Prom/starlink.software_version,#2) and length(last(/Starlink dish by Prom/starlink.software_version))>0
triggers.name: Starlink firmware has changed
triggers.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

items.name: Starlink state
items.description:
As string describing the current connectivity state of the user terminal. One of: 

"UNKNOWN", "CONNECTED", "BOOTING", "SEARCHING", "STOWED", "THERMAL_SHUTDOWN", "NO_SATS", "OBSTRUCTED", "NO_DOWNLINK", "NO_PINGS"

triggers.expression: last(/Starlink dish by Prom/starlink.state,#1)<>last(/Starlink dish by Prom/starlink.state,#2) and length(last(/Starlink dish by Prom/starlink.state))>0
triggers.name: Starlink status has changed
triggers.description: Status has changed. Ack to close

items.name: Starlink status alert install pending
items.description: Alert corresponding with bit 7 (bit mask 128) in *alerts*.

triggers.name: Starlink alert install pending
triggers.description: Starlink alert install pending. Ack to close

items.name: Starlink status alert is heating
items.description: Alert corresponding with bit 8 (bit mask 256) in *alerts*.

triggers.name: Starlink alert Terminal is heating
triggers.description: Starlink alert Terminal is heating. Ack to close

items.name: Starlink status alert mast not near vertical
items.description: Alert corresponding with bit 4 (bit mask 16) in *alerts*.

triggers.name: Starlink alert Terminal mast not near vertical
triggers.description: Starlink alert Terminal mast not near vertical. Ack to close

items.name: Starlink status alert motors stuck
items.description: Alert corresponding with bit 0 (bit mask 1) in *alerts*.

triggers.name: Starlink alert motors stuck
triggers.description: Starlink alert motors stuck. Ack to close

items.name: Starlink status alert power supply thermal throttle
items.description: Alert corresponding with bit 9 (bit mask 512) in *alerts*.

items.name: Starlink status alert slow ethernet speeds
items.description: Alert corresponding with bit 5 (bit mask 32) in *alerts*.

items.name: Starlink status alert thermal shutdown
items.description: Alert corresponding with bit 1 (bit mask 2) in *alerts*.

items.name: Starlink status alert thermal throttle
items.description: lert corresponding with bit 2 (bit mask 4) in *alerts*.

items.name: Starlink status alert unexpected location
items.description: Alert corresponding with bit 3 (bit mask 8) in *alerts*.

items.name: Starlink uplink throughput bps
items.description: Most recent sample value. See bulk history data for detail.

items.name: Starlink uptime
items.description:
The amount of time, in seconds, since the user terminal last rebooted.

Starlink uptime in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

triggers.name: starlink_exporter is not available (or no data for 30m)
triggers.description: Failed to fetch starlink metrics from starlink_exporter in time.
